resources.string: Each player chooses heads or tails. A coin will flip revealing either a purple side or a gold side, representing heads or tails respectively. If the player is correct they get one point.

On a 3x3 grid each player takes turns placing their symbol in order to try and get three in a row. Whoever gets three in a row first wins and gets a point. If the board fills and no one gets 3 in a row, the result is a draw. Player 1 is X, Player 2 is O
Player 1 plays at the top of the screen and Player 2 at the bottom. Both players control their paddles by dragging their finger on their side of the screen. First player to score wins.
